00055 /*****************************************************************************\
00056  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00057  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00058  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00059  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00060  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00061  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00062  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00063 \*****************************************************************************/

00074 /*=========================================================================*/
00075 /*
00076  *    specific data sizes
00077  */

00079 
00080 int M_tahoe_size_long = 64;
00081 int M_tahoe_size_pointer = 64;
00082 int M_tahoe_align_long = 64;
00083 int M_tahoe_align_pointer = 64;
00084 
00085 #define M_TAHOE_SIZE_VOID       0
00086 #define M_TAHOE_SIZE_BIT        1
00087 #define M_TAHOE_SIZE_CHAR       8
00088 #define M_TAHOE_SIZE_SHORT      16
00089 #define M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT        32
00090 #define M_TAHOE_SIZE_LONG       M_tahoe_size_long
00091 #define M_TAHOE_SIZE_POINTER    M_tahoe_size_pointer
00092 #define M_TAHOE_SIZE_LLONG      64
00093 #define M_TAHOE_SIZE_FLOAT      32
00094 #define M_TAHOE_SIZE_DOUBLE     64
00095 #define M_TAHOE_SIZE_MAX        64
00096 
00097 #define M_TAHOE_ALIGN_VOID      -1
00098 #define M_TAHOE_ALIGN_BIT       1
00099 #define M_TAHOE_ALIGN_CHAR      8
00100 #define M_TAHOE_ALIGN_SHORT     16
00101 #define M_TAHOE_ALIGN_INT       32
00102 #define M_TAHOE_ALIGN_LONG      M_tahoe_align_long
00103 #define M_TAHOE_ALIGN_POINTER   M_tahoe_align_pointer
00104 #define M_TAHOE_ALIGN_LLONG     64
00105 #define M_TAHOE_ALIGN_FLOAT     32
00106 #define M_TAHOE_ALIGN_DOUBLE    64
00107 #define M_TAHOE_ALIGN_MAX       64
00108 
00109 
00110 int
00111 M_tahoe_type_size (int mtype)
00112 {
00113   switch (mtype)
00114     {
00115     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00116       return M_TAHOE_SIZE_VOID;
00117     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00118     case M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT:
00119     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00120     case M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG:
00121       return M_TAHOE_SIZE_BIT;
00122     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00123       return M_TAHOE_SIZE_CHAR;
00124     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00125       return M_TAHOE_SIZE_SHORT;
00126     case M_TYPE_INT:
00127       return M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT;
00128     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00129       return M_TAHOE_SIZE_LONG;
00130     case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00131       return M_TAHOE_SIZE_LLONG;
00132     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00133       return M_TAHOE_SIZE_FLOAT;
00134     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00135       return M_TAHOE_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00136     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00137       return M_TAHOE_SIZE_POINTER;
00138     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00139     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00140     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00141     default:
00142       return -1;
00143     }
00144 }
00145 
00146 
00147 int
00148 M_tahoe_type_align (int mtype)
00149 {
00150   switch (mtype)
00151     {
00152     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00153       return M_TAHOE_ALIGN_VOID;
00154     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00155       return M_TAHOE_ALIGN_BIT;
00156     case M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT:
00157       return M_TAHOE_ALIGN_BIT;
00158     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00159       return M_TAHOE_ALIGN_BIT;
00160     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00161       return M_TAHOE_ALIGN_CHAR;
00162     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00163       return M_TAHOE_ALIGN_SHORT;
00164     case M_TYPE_INT:
00165       return M_TAHOE_ALIGN_INT;
00166     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00167       return M_TAHOE_ALIGN_LONG;
00168     case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00169       return M_TAHOE_ALIGN_LLONG;
00170     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00171       return M_TAHOE_ALIGN_FLOAT;
00172     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00173       return M_TAHOE_ALIGN_DOUBLE;
00174     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00175       return M_TAHOE_ALIGN_POINTER;
00176     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00177     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00178     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00179     default:
00180       return -1;
00181     }
00182 }

00185 /*
00186  *    The following functions are for documentation only.
00187  *      The function overhead is too great for actual usage.
00188  */
00189 void
00190 M_tahoe_void (M_Type type)
00191 {
00192   type->type = M_TYPE_VOID;
00193   type->unsign = 1;
00194   type->align = M_TAHOE_ALIGN_VOID;
00195   type->size = M_TAHOE_SIZE_VOID;
00196   type->nbits = 0;
00197 }
00198 
00199 void
00200 M_tahoe_bit_llong (M_Type type, int n)
00201 {
00202   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG;
00203   type->unsign = 1;
00204   type->align = M_TAHOE_ALIGN_BIT;
00205   type->size = n * M_TAHOE_SIZE_BIT;
00206   type->nbits = n * M_TAHOE_SIZE_BIT;
00207   M_assert ((n <= 64),
00208             "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 64 bits");
00209 }
00210 
00211 void
00212 M_tahoe_bit_long (M_Type type, int n)
00213 {
00214   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
00215   type->unsign = 1;
00216   type->align = M_TAHOE_ALIGN_BIT;
00217   type->size = n * M_TAHOE_SIZE_BIT;
00218   type->nbits = n * M_TAHOE_SIZE_BIT;
00219   M_assert ((n <= 64),
00220             "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 64 bits");
00221 }
00222

00340 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00341 
00342 int
00343 M_tahoe_eval_type (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00344 {
00345   int rtype = type->type;
00346 
00347   switch (rtype)
00348     {
00349     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00350       M_tahoe_void (ntype);
00351       rtype = -1;
00352       break;
00353     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00354     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00355     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00356     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00357     case M_TYPE_INT:
00358     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00359       /* the starting address of array is used */
00360       M_tahoe_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00361       rtype = M_TYPE_INT;
00362       break;
00363     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00364       if (M_TAHOE_SIZE_LONG == 32)
00365         {
00366           M_tahoe_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00367           rtype = M_TYPE_INT;
00368         }
00369       else if (M_TAHOE_SIZE_LONG == 64)
00370         {
00371           M_tahoe_llong (ntype, type->unsign);
00372           rtype = M_TYPE_LLONG;
00373         }
00374       else
00375         {
00376           I_punt("M_tahoe_eval_type: "
00377                  "M_TAHOE_SIZE_LONG not 32 or 64 bits: %d.",
00378                  M_TAHOE_SIZE_LONG);
00379         }
00380       break;
00381     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00382       if (M_TAHOE_SIZE_POINTER == 32)
00383         {
00384           M_tahoe_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00385           rtype = M_TYPE_INT;
00386         }
00387       else if (M_TAHOE_SIZE_POINTER == 64)
00388         {
00389           M_tahoe_llong (ntype, type->unsign);
00390           rtype = M_TYPE_LLONG;
00391         }
00392       else
00393         {
00394           I_punt("M_tahoe_eval_type: "
00395                  "M_TAHOE_SIZE_POINTER not 32 or 64 bits: %d.",
00396                  M_TAHOE_SIZE_POINTER);
00397         }
00398       break;
00399     case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00400       M_tahoe_llong (ntype, type->unsign);
00401       break;
00402     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00403       M_tahoe_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00404       break;
00405     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00406       M_tahoe_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00407       break;
00408     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00409     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00410       *ntype = *type;
00411       break;
00412     default:
00413       rtype = -1;
00414     }
00415   return rtype;
00416 }
00417 
00418 int
00419 M_tahoe_eval_type2 (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00420 {
00421   switch (type->type)
00422     {
00423     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00424       M_tahoe_void (ntype);
00425       return (-1);              /* can not be evaluated */
00426     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00427     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00428       M_tahoe_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00429       return (M_TYPE_CHAR);
00430     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00431       M_tahoe_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00432       return (M_TYPE_SHORT);
00433     case M_TYPE_INT:
00434     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00435       M_tahoe_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00436       return (M_TYPE_INT);
00437     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00438     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00439       M_tahoe_long (ntype, type->unsign);
00440       return (M_TYPE_LONG);
00441     case M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG:
00442     case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00443       M_tahoe_llong (ntype, type->unsign);
00444       return (M_TYPE_INT);
00445     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00446       M_tahoe_pointer (ntype);
00447       return (M_TYPE_POINTER);
00448     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00449       M_tahoe_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00450       return (M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00451     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00452       M_tahoe_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00453       return (M_TYPE_DOUBLE);
00454     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00455     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00456       *ntype = *type;
00457       return type->type;
00458     default:
00459       return (-1);
00460     }
00461 }
00462 
00463 int
00464 M_tahoe_call_type (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00465 {
00466   switch (type->type)
00467     {
00468     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00469       M_tahoe_void (ntype);
00470       return (-1);              /* can not be evaluated */
00471     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00472     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00473     case M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG:
00474     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00475     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00476     case M_TYPE_INT:
00477     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00478     case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00479     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00480     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00481       /* the starting address of array is used */
00482       M_tahoe_llong (ntype, type->unsign);
00483       return (M_TYPE_LLONG);
00484     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00485     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00486       M_tahoe_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00487       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00488     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00489     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00490       *ntype = *type;
00491       return (type->type);
00492     default:
00493       return (-1);
00494     }
00495 }
00496 
00497 int
00498 M_tahoe_call_type2 (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00499 {
00500   switch (type->type)
00501     {
00502     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00503       M_tahoe_void (ntype);
00504       return (-1);              /* can not be evaluated */
00505     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00506     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00507       M_tahoe_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00508       return (M_TYPE_CHAR);
00509     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00510       M_tahoe_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00511       return (M_TYPE_SHORT);
00512     case M_TYPE_INT:
00513     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00514       /* the starting address of array is used */
00515       M_tahoe_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00516       return (M_TYPE_INT);
00517     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00518     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00519       M_tahoe_long (ntype, type->unsign);
00520       return (M_TYPE_LONG);
00521     case M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG:
00522     case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00523       M_tahoe_llong (ntype, type->unsign);
00524       return (M_TYPE_LLONG);
00525     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00526       M_tahoe_pointer (ntype);
00527       return (M_TYPE_POINTER);
00528     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00529       M_tahoe_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00530       return (M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00531     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00532       M_tahoe_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00533       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00534     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00535     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00536       *ntype = *type;
00537       return (type->type);
00538     default:
00539       return (-1);
00540     }
00541 }

00544 
00545 void
00546 M_tahoe_array_layout (M_Type type, int *offset)
00547 {
00548   *offset = 0;          /* assume first element is aligned */
00549   return;
00550 }
00551 
00552 
00553 int
00554 M_tahoe_array_align (M_Type type)
00555 {
00556   return type->align;
00557 }
00558 
00559 
00560 int
00561 M_tahoe_array_size (M_Type type, int dim)
00562 {
00563   int mod, size, align;
00564 
00565   size = type->size;
00566   align = type->align;
00567   if ((mod = size % align))
00568     size += (align - mod);
00569 
00570   return (size * dim);
00571 }
00572 
00573 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00574 
00575 void
00576 M_tahoe_union_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *offset, int *bit_offset)
00577 {
00578   int i;
00579 
00580   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00581     {                   /* assume the union is aligned */
00582       offset[i] = 0;
00583       bit_offset[i] = 0;
00584     }
00585   return;
00586 }
00587 
00588 int
00589 M_tahoe_union_align (int n, _M_Type * type)
00590 {
00591   int i, max;
00592 
00593   max = 0;
00594   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00595     {
00596       int aln = type[i].align;
00597       if (aln > max)
00598         max = aln;
00599     }
00600 
00601   /* minimum alignment is byte boundary */
00602 
00603   if (max < M_TAHOE_ALIGN_CHAR)
00604     max = M_TAHOE_ALIGN_CHAR;
00605   
00606   return max;
00607 }
00608 
00609 int
00610 M_tahoe_union_size (int n, _M_Type * type)
00611 {
00612   int i, aln, max_size, max_align;
00613 
00614   max_size = 0;
00615   max_align = 0;
00616   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00617     {
00618       int size;
00619       size = type[i].size;
00620       if (size > max_size)
00621         max_size = size;
00622       aln = type[i].align;
00623       if (aln > max_align)
00624         max_align = aln;
00625     }
00626 
00627   /* minimum alignment is byte boundary */
00628 
00629   if (max_align < M_TAHOE_ALIGN_CHAR)
00630     max_align = M_TAHOE_ALIGN_CHAR;
00631 
00632   /* need to increment to the max. align for future array extension */
00633 
00634   if ((i = max_size % max_align))
00635     max_size += (max_align - i);
00636   
00637   return max_size;
00638 }
00639 
00640 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00641 
00642 int
00643 M_tahoe_layout_order (void)
00644 {
00645   int endianness;
00646 
00647   switch (M_swarch) {
00648   case M_IPF_LIN_LP64:
00649   case M_IPF_WIN_P64:
00650     endianness = M_LITTLE_ENDIAN;
00651     break;
00652   case M_IPF_HPUX_LP64:
00653   case M_IPF_HPUX_ILP32:
00654     endianness = M_BIG_ENDIAN;
00655     break;
00656   default:
00657     endianness = -1;
00658     M_assert (0, "M_tahoe_layout_order: Invalid swarch");
00659   }
00660   return endianness;
00661 }
00662 
00663 
00664 /*
00665  * struct_layout
00666  *
00667  *    INPUTS:   n          - the number of elements in the structure
00668  *              type       - an array of _M_Type structures for each element
00669  *                           in the structure
00670  *
00671  *    OUTPUTS:  base       - an array in which to store the offset into the
00672  *                           struct which should be addressed to load the
00673  *                           element.
00674  *              bit_offset - an array in which to store the bit offset of the
00675  *                           element from the base
00676  */
00677 void
00678 M_tahoe_struct_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *base, int *bit_offset)
00679 {
00680   int i;                        /* index for arrays */
00681   int offset;                   /* the current offset into the struct */
00682   int mod;                      /* */
00683   int size;                     /* the size of the current element */
00684   int align;                    /* the aligment requirement of the
00685                                  * current element */
00686   int word_off;                 /* the offset into the current word */
00687   int bf_unit_size = 0;         /* the unit size of the bitfield
00688                                  * (eg. char, short, long) */
00689   int bf_unit_off;              /* the offset into current bitfield
00690                                  * unit size */
00691 
00692   int mod_word, mod_type;
00693 
00694   offset = 0;           /* assume initially aligned */
00695   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00696     {
00697       size = type[i].size;
00698       align = type[i].align;
00699       M_assert ((size != 0) && (align != 0),
00700                 "M_struct_layout: void is not allowed in structure");
00701       /*
00702        *  need to treat bit fields specially.
00703        *  keep them in a word when possible.
00704        */
00705 
00706       if (M_tahoe_layout_order () == M_BIG_ENDIAN)
00707         {
00708           mod_word = offset % M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT;
00709           if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00710             {
00711               if ((mod_word + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT)
00712                 offset += (M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00713               else
00714                 {
00715                   mod_type = offset % M_TAHOE_SIZE_CHAR;
00716                   if ((mod_type + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_CHAR)
00717                     {
00718                       /*
00719                        * fprintf(stdout,"Changing bit char to bit short\n");
00720                        */
00721                       type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT;
00722                     }
00723                 }
00724             }
00725           if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT)
00726             {
00727               if ((mod_word + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT)
00728                 offset += (M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00729               else
00730                 {
00731                   mod_type = offset % M_TAHOE_SIZE_SHORT;
00732                   if ((mod_type + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_SHORT)
00733                     {
00734                       /*
00735                        * fprintf(stdout,"Changing bit short to bit long\n");
00736                        */
00737                       type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
00738                     }
00739                 }
00740             }
00741           else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00742             {
00743               if ((mod_word + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT)
00744                 offset += (M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00745             }
00746           
00747           mod = offset % align; /* align to what the field */
00748           if (mod != 0) /* needs to start from */
00749             offset += (align - mod);
00750           
00751           if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00752             {
00753               int mod = offset % M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT;
00754               
00755               bit_offset[i] =
00756                 offset - mod + (M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT - mod - size);
00757               base[i] = offset & (~(M_TAHOE_SIZE_CHAR - 1));
00758             }
00759           else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT)
00760             {
00761               int mod = offset % M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT;
00762 
00763               bit_offset[i] =
00764                 offset - mod + (M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT - mod - size);
00765               base[i] = offset & (~(M_TAHOE_SIZE_SHORT - 1));
00766             }
00767           else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00768             {
00769               int mod = offset % M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT;
00770               
00771               bit_offset[i] =
00772                 offset - mod + (M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT - mod - size);
00773               base[i] = offset & (~(M_TAHOE_SIZE_LONG - 1));
00774             }
00775           else
00776             {
00777               base[i] = offset;
00778               bit_offset[i] = 0;
00779             }
00780           
00781           offset += size;       /* allocate space */
00782           
00783           
00784         }
00785       else if (M_tahoe_layout_order () == M_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
00786         {
00787           
00788           /*
00789            *  need to treat bit fields specially:
00790            *      - keep them in a word when possible
00791            *      - increase the unit size if necessary
00792            */
00793           if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR ||
00794               type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT ||
00795               type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00796             {
00797               word_off = offset % M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT;
00798               
00799               /* if element doesn't fit in word,
00800                * then its offset is beginning of the next word */
00801               if ((word_off + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT)
00802                 offset += (M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT - word_off);
00803               
00804               /* if element doesn't fit in aligned unit size, 
00805                  then successively
00806                  * increase unit size until it does */
00807               if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00808                 {
00809                   bf_unit_size = M_TAHOE_SIZE_CHAR;
00810                   bf_unit_off = offset % bf_unit_size;
00811                   
00812                   /* use for standard bitfields */
00813                   if ((bf_unit_off + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_CHAR)
00814                     {
00815                       type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT;
00816                       bf_unit_size = M_TAHOE_SIZE_SHORT;
00817                     }
00818                 }
00819               if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT)
00820                 {
00821                   bf_unit_size = M_TAHOE_SIZE_SHORT;
00822                   bf_unit_off = offset % bf_unit_size;
00823                   
00824                   /* use for standard bitfields */
00825                   if ((bf_unit_off + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_SHORT)
00826                     {
00827                       type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
00828                       bf_unit_size = M_TAHOE_SIZE_LONG;
00829                     }
00830                   
00831                 }
00832               if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00833                 {
00834                   bf_unit_size = M_TAHOE_SIZE_LONG;
00835                   bf_unit_off = offset % bf_unit_size;
00836                   if ((bf_unit_off + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_LONG)
00837                     {
00838                       /* problem:  can't increase size any more */
00839                       M_assert (0,
00840                                 "M_tahoe_struct_layout:  bitfield "
00841                                 "element does not fit in one word");
00842                     }
00843                 }
00844               
00845             }           /* end special treatment of bitfields */
00846           
00847           
00848           /* adjust offset to required alignment */
00849           mod = offset % align;
00850           if (mod != 0)
00851             offset += (align - mod);
00852           
00853 
00854           /* calculate the base (the offset into the struct which should
00855            * be addressed to load the element) */
00856           /* calculate the bit_offset (the bit offset from the base of the
00857            * element) */
00858           switch (type[i].type)
00859             {
00860             case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00861             case M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT:
00862             case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00863               base[i] = offset & (~(bf_unit_size - 1));   /*mask off 
00864                                                             low bits */
00865               bit_offset[i] = offset - base[i];
00866 #if 0
00867               fprintf (stderr,
00868                        "bitfields:  type = %d, base = %d, bit_offset = %d"
00869                        "\n", type[i].type, base[i], bit_offset[i]);
00870 #endif
00871               break;
00872             default:
00873               bit_offset[i] = 0;
00874               base[i] = offset;
00875 #if 0
00876               fprintf (stderr, "type = %d, base = %d, bit_offset = %d\n",
00877                        type[i].type, base[i], bit_offset[i]);
00878 #endif
00879             }
00880           /* adjust offset to allocate space for current element */
00881           offset += size;
00882         }
00883       else
00884         {
00885           M_assert (0, "M_tahoe_struct_layout: endian ordering not set");
00886         }
00887       
00888     }
00889   return;
00890 }
00891 
00892 int
00893 M_tahoe_struct_align (int n, _M_Type * type)
00894 {
00895   int i, max;
00896 
00897   max = 0;
00898   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00899     {
00900       int aln = type[i].align;
00901       if (aln > max)
00902         max = aln;
00903     }
00904 
00905   /* minimum alignment is byte boundary */
00906   if (max < M_TAHOE_ALIGN_CHAR)
00907     max = M_TAHOE_ALIGN_CHAR;
00908   return max;
00909 }
00910 
00911 
00912 int
00913 M_tahoe_struct_size (int n, _M_Type * type, int struct_align)
00914 {
00915 
00916   int i, offset;
00917   int mod, size, align, max_align, mod_word;
00918   int word_off;
00919 
00920   offset = 0;           /* assume initially aligned */
00921   max_align = struct_align;
00922   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00923     {
00924       size = type[i].size;
00925       align = type[i].align;
00926       M_assert ((size != 0) && (align != 0),
00927                 "M_struct_layout: void is not allowed in structure");
00928       if (align > max_align)
00929         max_align = align;
00930       /*
00931        *  need to treat bit fields specially.
00932        *  keep them in a word when possible.
00933        */
00934       
00935       /* Endian Choice: Big or small */
00936       if (M_tahoe_layout_order () == M_BIG_ENDIAN)
00937         {
00938           
00939           mod_word = offset % M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT;
00940           if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00941             {
00942               if ((mod_word + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT)
00943                 offset += (M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00944               if (M_TAHOE_ALIGN_CHAR > max_align)
00945                 max_align = M_TAHOE_ALIGN_CHAR;
00946             }
00947           else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT)
00948             {
00949               if ((mod_word + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT)
00950                 offset += (M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00951               if (M_TAHOE_ALIGN_SHORT > max_align)
00952                 max_align = M_TAHOE_ALIGN_SHORT;
00953             }
00954           else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00955             {
00956               if ((mod_word + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT)
00957                 offset += (M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00958               if (M_TAHOE_ALIGN_LONG > max_align)
00959                 max_align = M_TAHOE_ALIGN_LONG;
00960             }
00961           
00962         }
00963       else if (M_tahoe_layout_order () == M_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
00964         {
00965           
00966           if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR ||
00967               type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT ||
00968               type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00969             {
00970               word_off = offset % M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT;
00971               
00972               if ((word_off + size) > M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT)
00973                 {
00974                   /* if element doesn't fit in word,
00975                    * then its offset is beginning of the next word */
00976                   offset += (M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT - word_off);
00977                 }
00978               
00979             }
00980           
00981         }
00982       else
00983         {
00984           M_assert (0, "M_tahoe_struct_size: endian ordering not set");
00985         }
00986       
00987       mod = offset % align;     /* align to what the field */
00988       if (mod != 0)             /* needs to start from */
00989         offset += (align - mod);
00990       
00991       offset += size;
00992         }
00993   
00994   /* minimum alignment is byte boundary */
00995   if (max_align < M_TAHOE_ALIGN_CHAR)
00996     max_align = M_TAHOE_ALIGN_CHAR;
00997   /* enforce max. alignment */
00998   mod = offset % max_align;
00999   if (mod != 0)
01000     offset += (max_align - mod);
01001   return offset;
01002 }
01003 
01004 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01005 
01006 int
01007 M_tahoe_no_short_int (void)
01008 {
01009   return (M_TAHOE_SIZE_SHORT == M_TAHOE_SIZE_INT);
01010 }

01012 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01013 
01014 void
01015 M_tahoe_cb_label_name (char *fn, int cb, char *line, int len)
01016 {
01017   sprintf (line, "cb%d%s", cb, fn);
01018 }
01019 
01020 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01021 
01022 int
01023 M_tahoe_is_cb_label (char *label, char *fn, int *cb)
01024 {
01025   return (sscanf (label, "cb%d%s", cb, fn) == 2);
01026 }
01027 
01028 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01029 
01030 void
01031 M_tahoe_jumptbl_label_name (char *fn, int tbl_id, char *line, int len)
01032 {
01033   sprintf (line, "%s%s%d", fn, M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME, tbl_id);
01034   return;
01035 }
01036 
01037 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01038 
01039 int
01040 M_tahoe_is_jumptbl_label (char *label, char *fn, int *tbl_id)
01041 {
01042   /* Format for v1.0 is: %sM_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME%d, where %s is the func 
01043    * name 
01044    */
01045   char *ptr;
01046   int label_len, fn_len, base_len;
01047   
01048   /* Some length checks, to make sure we dont step outside array */
01049   label_len = strlen (label);
01050   fn_len = strlen (fn);
01051   base_len = strlen (M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME);
01052   if (label_len <= (fn_len + base_len))
01053     return (0);
01054   
01055   /* Check that fn is correct */
01056   ptr = label;
01057   if (strncmp (ptr, fn, fn_len))
01058     return (0);
01059 
01060   /* Check that jumptbl base name is correct */
01061   ptr += fn_len;
01062   if (strncmp (ptr, M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME, base_len))
01063     return (0);
01064   
01065   /* Get the id */
01066   ptr += base_len;
01067   return (sscanf (ptr, "%d", tbl_id) == 1);
01068 }
01069 
01070 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01071 
01072 int
01073 M_tahoe_structure_pointer (int purpose)
01074 {
01075   return M_TAHOE_RET_INT_BASE;
01076 }
01077 
01078 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01079 
01080 int
01081 M_tahoe_return_register (int type, int purpose)
01082 {
01083   switch (type)
01084     {
01085     case M_TYPE_INT:
01086       return M_TAHOE_RET_INT_BASE;
01087     case M_TYPE_LONG:
01088       return M_TAHOE_RET_INT_BASE;
01089     case M_TYPE_LLONG:
01090       return M_TAHOE_RET_INT_BASE;
01091     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
01092       return M_TAHOE_RET_FLT_BASE;
01093     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
01094       return M_TAHOE_RET_FLT_BASE;
01095     default:
01096       return M_TAHOE_RET_INT_BASE;
01097     }
01098 }

01100 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01101 
01102 char *
01103 M_tahoe_fn_label_name (char *label, int (*is_func) (char *is_func_label))
01104 {
01105   static char fn_label[64];
01106   
01107   if ((*is_func) (label))
01108     {
01109       sprintf (fn_label, "$fn_%s", label);
01110       return (fn_label);
01111     }
01112   else
01113     {
01114       return (label);
01115     }
01116 }
01117 
01118 char *
01119 M_tahoe_fn_name_from_label (char *label)
01120 {
01121   if (!strncmp (label, "_$fn", 4))
01122     return (label + 4);
01123   else
01124     return (label);
01125 }

01127 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01128 
01129 void
01130 M_set_model_tahoe (char *model_name)
01131 {
01132   if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "itanium"))
01133     {
01134       M_model = M_IPF_ITANIUM;                  /* 6/2001 */
01135     }
01136   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "mckinley"))
01137     {
01138       M_model = M_IPF_MCKINLEY;                 /* ?/2002 */
01139     }
01140   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "madison"))
01141     {
01142       M_model = M_IPF_MADISON;                  /* ?/2003 */
01143     }
01144   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "deerfield"))
01145     {
01146       M_model = M_IPF_DEERFIELD;                /* ?/2004 */
01147     }
01148   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "mendocito"))
01149     {
01150       M_model = M_IPF_MENDOCITO;                /* ?/2005 */
01151     }
01152   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "chivano"))
01153     {
01154       M_model = M_IPF_CHIVANO;                  /* ?/2006 */
01155     }
01156   else
01157     {
01158       fprintf (stderr, "illegal model_name : %s\n", model_name);
01159       fprintf (stderr, "Use one of the following: ITANIUM, MCKINLEY\n");
01160       M_assert (0, "M_set_model_tahoe: illegal model name specified");
01161     }
01162 
01163   M_use_layout_database = 1;
01164   return;
01165 }
01166 
01167 void
01168 M_set_swarch_tahoe (char *model_name)
01169 {
01170   if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "linux"))
01171     {
01172       M_swarch = M_IPF_LIN_LP64;
01173       M_tahoe_size_long = 64;
01174       M_tahoe_size_pointer = 64;
01175       M_tahoe_align_long = 64;
01176       M_tahoe_align_pointer = 64;
01177     }
01178   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "hpux64"))
01179     {
01180       M_swarch = M_IPF_HPUX_LP64;
01181       M_tahoe_size_long = 64;
01182       M_tahoe_size_pointer = 64;
01183       M_tahoe_align_long = 64;
01184       M_tahoe_align_pointer = 64;
01185     }
01186   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "hpux32"))
01187     {
01188       M_swarch = M_IPF_HPUX_ILP32;
01189       M_tahoe_size_long = 32;
01190       M_tahoe_size_pointer = 32;
01191       M_tahoe_align_long = 32;
01192       M_tahoe_align_pointer = 32;
01193     }
01194   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "win64"))
01195     {
01196       M_swarch = M_IPF_WIN_P64;
01197       M_tahoe_size_long = 32;
01198       M_tahoe_size_pointer = 64;
01199       M_tahoe_align_long = 32;
01200       M_tahoe_align_pointer = 64;
01201     }
01202   else
01203     {
01204       fprintf (stderr, "illegal swarch: %s\n", model_name);
01205       fprintf (stderr, "Use one of the following: LINUX, WIN64, HPUX64, HPUX32\n");
01206       M_assert (0, "M_set_model_tahoe: illegal model name specified");
01207     }
01208   return;
01209 }
01210 
01211 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01212 
01213 /* align_bit = bits, offset = bytes */
01214 static int
01215 M_align_offset(int offset, int align_bit)
01216 {
01217   int mod;
01218   int align = align_bit / 8;
01219 
01220   if ((align_bit % 8) != 0)
01221     I_punt("M_align_offset: alignment not multiple of 8 = %d\n",
01222            align_bit);
01223 
01224   mod = offset % align;
01225   if (mod != 0)
01226     offset += (align - mod);  
01227 
01228   return offset;
01229 }
01230 
01231 
01232 /*
01233  * M_tahoe_layout_fnvar
01234  * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01235  * Lay out function incoming / outgoing parameters according to 
01236  * IA-64 Software Conventions and Runtime Architecture Guide
01237  * Intel Doc. No. 245256-001, August, 1999.
01238  *
01239  * EXCEPTION: Homogeneous floating-point aggregates (HFA) are
01240  *            handled as an ordinary aggregate type.
01241  */
01242 int
01243 M_tahoe_layout_fnvar (List param_list, char **macro, int *pcount, int purpose)
01244 {
01245   M_Param param;
01246   int current_offset;
01247   int int_reg_base;
01248   int param_position, fp_param_position;
01249   int extra_space;
01250 
01251   /* Ltahoe stack frame, parameter portion.
01252    *
01253    *              |   ...    |
01254    *              +----------+
01255    *              |    P9    |
01256    *              +----------+ <-- IP + 24
01257    *              |    P8    |
01258    *              +----------+ <-- IP + 16
01259    *              | SCRATCH1 |
01260    *              +----------+ <-- IP + 8
01261    *  CALLER      | SCRATCH0 |
01262    *  ------      +----------+ <-- IP (PSP)
01263    *  CALLEE      |   ...    |
01264    */
01265 
01266   switch (purpose)
01267     {
01268     case M_GET_FNVAR:
01269       *macro = "$IP";
01270       int_reg_base = M_TAHOE_IN_INT_BASE;
01271       break;
01272     case M_PUT_FNVAR:
01273       *macro = "$OP";
01274       int_reg_base = M_TAHOE_OUT_INT_BASE;
01275       break;
01276     case M_RET_FNVAR:
01277       M_assert (0, "M_layout_fnvar: M_RET_FNVAR unsupported");
01278       *macro = "$P16";
01279       int_reg_base = M_TAHOE_RET_INT_BASE;
01280       break;
01281     case M_DONT_CARE_FNVAR:
01282     default:
01283       M_assert (0, "M_layout_fnvar: unknown purpose");
01284       return (-1);
01285     }
01286 
01287   param_position = 0;
01288   fp_param_position = 0;
01289   current_offset = SCRATCH_SPACE_SIZE;
01290 
01291   List_start (param_list);
01292   while ((param = (M_Param) List_next (param_list)))
01293     {
01294       int tp, size, align, is_hfa;
01295       tp = param->mtype.type;
01296       size = param->mtype.size;
01297       align = param->mtype.align;
01298 
01299       /* initialize */
01300 
01301       param->offset = param->paddr = param->su_sreg = param->su_ereg = 0;
01302       
01303       switch (tp)
01304         {
01305         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
01306         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
01307         case M_TYPE_INT:
01308         case M_TYPE_LONG:
01309         case M_TYPE_POINTER:
01310         case M_TYPE_LLONG:
01311           if (param_position < M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG)
01312             {
01313               param->mode = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01314               param->reg = param_position + int_reg_base;
01315               param->offset = 0;
01316               param_position++;
01317             }
01318           else
01319             {
01320               param->mode = M_THRU_MEMORY;
01321               param->reg = -1;
01322               current_offset = M_align_offset(current_offset, align);
01323               param->offset = current_offset;
01324               current_offset += (M_TAHOE_SIZE_LLONG / 8);
01325             }
01326           break;
01327 
01328         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
01329         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
01330           if (param_position < M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_FLT_REG)
01331             {
01332               param->mode = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01333               param->reg = fp_param_position + M_TAHOE_FLT_BASE;
01334               param->offset = 0;
01335               fp_param_position++;
01336               param_position++;
01337             }
01338           else
01339             {
01340               /* Verify alignment */
01341               current_offset = M_align_offset(current_offset, align);
01342               
01343               param->mode = M_THRU_MEMORY;
01344               param->reg = -1;
01345               param->offset = current_offset;
01346               current_offset += (M_TAHOE_SIZE_DOUBLE / 8);
01347             }
01348           break;
01349 
01350         case M_TYPE_UNION:
01351         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
01352 
01353           is_hfa = param->mtype.flags & M_TYFL_HFA;
01354 
01355           if (is_hfa)
01356             I_warn ("Setting up HFA fnvar");
01357 
01358           /*printf("size %d (%d bytes) align %d\n",size,size/8,align); */
01359 
01360           if (param_position < M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG)
01361             {
01362               if (align == 128)
01363                 {
01364                   /* 128 bit alignment means use next even register */
01365                   if (param_position & 0x1)
01366                     param_position++;
01367                 }
01368               else
01369                 {
01370                   /* use next register */
01371                   M_assert ((align <= 64),
01372                             "M_tahoe_layout_fnvar: Unexpected alignment\n");
01373                 }
01374             }
01375 
01376           if (param_position < M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG)
01377             {
01378               int regs_needed;
01379 
01380               param->mode = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01381               param->reg = -1;
01382               param->su_sreg = param_position + int_reg_base;
01383               param->paddr = param_position;
01384 
01385               regs_needed = (size / M_TAHOE_SIZE_LLONG);
01386               if (size % M_TAHOE_SIZE_LLONG)
01387                 regs_needed++;
01388 
01389               if (regs_needed + param_position < M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG)
01390                 {
01391                   /* Struct fits entirely into param regs */
01392                   param_position += regs_needed;
01393                   param->offset = -1;
01394                   param->su_ereg = param_position + int_reg_base - 1;
01395                 }
01396               else
01397                 {
01398                   /* Struct fills remaining regs and overlaps into memory */
01399                   regs_needed = regs_needed - (M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG
01400                                                - param_position);
01401                   param_position = M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG;
01402                   extra_space = M_TAHOE_SIZE_LLONG * regs_needed;
01403                   param->offset = current_offset;
01404                   param->su_ereg = param_position + int_reg_base - 1;
01405                   current_offset += extra_space;
01406                 }
01407 
01408               if (is_hfa)
01409                 {
01410                   ;
01411                 }
01412             }
01413           else
01414             {
01415               param->mode = M_THRU_MEMORY;
01416               param->reg = -1;
01417               param->su_sreg = -1;
01418               param->su_ereg = -1;
01419               param->paddr = -1;
01420 
01421               /* Verify alignment */
01422               current_offset = M_align_offset(current_offset, align);
01423               
01424               param->offset = current_offset;
01425               current_offset += size / 8;
01426             }
01427           break;
01428 
01429         default:
01430           M_assert (0, "M_layout_fnvar: argument is not promoted");
01431         }
01432     }
01433 
01434   {
01435     int marker = M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG - param_position;
01436 
01437     List_start (param_list);
01438     while ((param = (M_Param) List_next (param_list)))
01439       {
01440         if ((param->paddr >= 0) && 
01441             ((param->mtype.type == M_TYPE_UNION) ||
01442              (param->mtype.type == M_TYPE_STRUCT)))
01443           param->paddr += marker;
01444       }
01445   }
01446 
01447   *pcount = param_position;
01448   /* size necessary for parameters */
01449   return (current_offset - SCRATCH_SPACE_SIZE); 
01450 }
01451 
01452 /*
01453  * M_tahoe_fnvar_layout
01454  * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01455  * Lay out function incoming / outgoing parameters according to 
01456  * IA-64 Software Conventions and Runtime Architecture Guide
01457  * Intel Doc. No. 245256-001, August, 1999.
01458  *
01459  * EXCEPTION: Homogeneous floating-point aggregates (HFA) are
01460  *            handled as an ordinary aggregate type.
01461  */
01462 
01463 int
01464 M_tahoe_fnvar_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, long int *offset, int *mode,
01465                       int *reg, int *paddr, char **macro,
01466                       int *su_sreg, int *su_ereg,
01467                       int *pcount, int is_st, int purpose)
01468 {
01469   int i, current_offset;
01470   int int_reg_base;
01471   int param_position, fp_param_position;
01472   int extra_space;
01473   int endoffset[128];
01474 
01475   /* Ltahoe stack frame, parameter portion.
01476    *
01477    *              |   ...    |
01478    *              +----------+
01479    *              |    P9    |
01480    *              +----------+ <-- IP + 24
01481    *              |    P8    |
01482    *              +----------+ <-- IP + 16
01483    *              | SCRATCH1 |
01484    *              +----------+ <-- IP + 8
01485    *  CALLER      | SCRATCH0 |
01486    *  ------      +----------+ <-- IP (PSP)
01487    *  CALLEE      |   ...    |
01488    */
01489 
01490   switch (purpose)
01491     {
01492     case M_GET_FNVAR:
01493       *macro = "$IP";
01494       int_reg_base = M_TAHOE_IN_INT_BASE;
01495       break;
01496     case M_PUT_FNVAR:
01497       *macro = "$OP";
01498       int_reg_base = M_TAHOE_OUT_INT_BASE;
01499       break;
01500     case M_DONT_CARE_FNVAR:
01501     default:
01502       M_assert (0, "M_fnvar_layout: unknown purpose");
01503       return (-1);
01504     }
01505 
01506   param_position = 0;
01507   fp_param_position = 0;
01508   current_offset = SCRATCH_SPACE_SIZE;
01509 
01510   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
01511     {
01512       int tp, size, align, is_hfa;
01513       tp = type[i].type;
01514       size = type[i].size;
01515       align = type[i].align;
01516       
01517       switch (tp)
01518         {
01519         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
01520         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
01521         case M_TYPE_INT:
01522         case M_TYPE_LONG:
01523         case M_TYPE_POINTER:
01524         case M_TYPE_LLONG:
01525           if (param_position < M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG)
01526             {
01527               mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01528               reg[i] = param_position + int_reg_base;
01529               offset[i] = 0;
01530               param_position++;
01531             }
01532           else
01533             {
01534               mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
01535               reg[i] = -1;
01536               current_offset = M_align_offset(current_offset, align);
01537               offset[i] = current_offset;
01538               current_offset += (M_TAHOE_SIZE_LLONG / 8);
01539             }
01540           break;
01541 
01542         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
01543         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
01544           if (param_position < M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_FLT_REG)
01545             {
01546               mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01547               reg[i] = fp_param_position + M_TAHOE_FLT_BASE;
01548               offset[i] = 0;
01549               fp_param_position++;
01550               param_position++;
01551             }
01552           else
01553             {
01554               /* Verify alignment */
01555               current_offset = M_align_offset(current_offset, align);
01556               
01557               mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
01558               reg[i] = -1;
01559               offset[i] = current_offset;
01560               current_offset += (M_TAHOE_SIZE_DOUBLE / 8);
01561             }
01562           break;
01563 
01564         case M_TYPE_UNION:
01565         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
01566 
01567           is_hfa = type[i].flags & M_TYFL_HFA;
01568 
01569           if (is_hfa)
01570             I_warn ("Setting up HFA fnvar");
01571 
01572           endoffset[i] = -1;
01573           /*printf("size %d (%d bytes) align %d\n",size,size/8,align); */
01574 
01575           if (param_position < M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG)
01576             {
01577               if (align == 128)
01578                 {
01579                   /* 128 bit alignment means use next even register */
01580                   if (param_position & 0x1)
01581                     param_position++;
01582                 }
01583               else
01584                 {
01585                   /* use next register */
01586                   M_assert ((align <= 64),
01587                             "M_tahoe_fnvar_layout: Unexpected alignment\n");
01588                 }
01589             }
01590 
01591           if (param_position < M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG)
01592             {
01593               int regs_needed;
01594 
01595               mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01596               reg[i] = -1;
01597               su_sreg[i] = param_position + int_reg_base;
01598               paddr[i] = param_position;
01599 
01600               regs_needed = (size / M_TAHOE_SIZE_LLONG);
01601               if (size % M_TAHOE_SIZE_LLONG)
01602                 regs_needed++;
01603 
01604               if (regs_needed + param_position < M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG)
01605                 {
01606                   /* Struct fits entirely into param regs */
01607                   param_position += regs_needed;
01608                   offset[i] = -1;
01609                   su_ereg[i] = param_position + int_reg_base - 1;
01610                 }
01611               else
01612                 {
01613                   /* Struct fills remaining regs and overlaps into memory */
01614                   regs_needed = regs_needed - (M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG
01615                                                - param_position);
01616                   param_position = M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG;
01617                   extra_space = M_TAHOE_SIZE_LLONG * regs_needed;
01618                   offset[i] = current_offset;
01619                   su_ereg[i] = param_position + int_reg_base - 1;
01620                   current_offset += extra_space;
01621                   endoffset[i] = current_offset;
01622                 }
01623 
01624               if (is_hfa)
01625                 {
01626                   ;
01627                 }
01628             }
01629           else
01630             {
01631               /* printf("M_tahoe_fnvar_layout: Struct/Union "
01632                         "through memory\n"); */
01633               mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
01634               reg[i] = -1;
01635               su_sreg[i] = -1;
01636               su_ereg[i] = -1;
01637               paddr[i] = -1;
01638 
01639               /* Verify alignment */
01640               current_offset = M_align_offset(current_offset, align);
01641               
01642               offset[i] = current_offset;
01643               current_offset += size / 8;
01644               endoffset[i] = current_offset;
01645             }
01646           break;
01647 
01648         default:
01649           M_assert (0, "M_fnvar_layout: argument is not promoted");
01650         }
01651     }
01652 
01653   {
01654     int marker;
01655 
01656     marker = M_TAHOE_MAX_FNVAR_INT_REG - param_position;
01657     for (i = (n - 1); i >= 0; i--)
01658       {
01659         if ((type[i].type == M_TYPE_UNION || 
01660              type[i].type == M_TYPE_STRUCT) &&
01661             paddr[i] >= 0)
01662           {
01663             paddr[i] = paddr[i] + marker;
01664           }
01665       }
01666   }
01667 
01668   *pcount = param_position;
01669   /* size necessary for parameters */
01670   return (current_offset - SCRATCH_SPACE_SIZE); 
01671 }
01672 
01673 
01674 int
01675 M_tahoe_layout_retvar (M_Param param, int purpose)
01676 {
01677   int tp;
01678 
01679   tp = param->mtype.type;
01680 
01681   /* initialize */
01682   
01683   param->offset = param->paddr = param->su_sreg = param->su_ereg = 0;
01684       
01685   switch (tp)
01686     {
01687     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
01688     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
01689     case M_TYPE_INT:
01690     case M_TYPE_LONG:
01691     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
01692     case M_TYPE_LLONG:
01693     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
01694     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
01695       param->mode = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01696       param->reg = M_tahoe_return_register (tp, 0);
01697       param->offset = 0;
01698       break;
01699 
01700     case M_TYPE_UNION:
01701     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
01702       {
01703         int is_hfa = param->mtype.flags & M_TYFL_HFA,
01704           size = param->mtype.size;
01705 
01706         if (is_hfa)
01707           I_warn ("Setting up HFA fn return");
01708 
01709         if (size <= 256)
01710           {
01711             int regs_needed = (size / M_TAHOE_SIZE_LLONG);
01712 
01713             if (size % M_TAHOE_SIZE_LLONG)
01714               regs_needed++;
01715 
01716             param->mode = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01717             param->reg = -1;
01718             param->su_sreg = M_TAHOE_RET_INT_BASE;
01719             param->su_ereg = M_TAHOE_RET_INT_BASE + regs_needed - 1;
01720             param->paddr = 0;
01721             param->offset = -1;
01722           }
01723         else
01724           {
01725             param->mode = M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER;
01726             param->reg = M_TAHOE_RET_INT_BASE;
01727             param->su_sreg = -1;
01728             param->su_ereg = -1;
01729             param->paddr = -1;
01730             param->offset = 0;
01731           }
01732       }
01733       break;
01734 
01735     default:
01736       M_assert (0, "M_layout_fnvar: argument is not promoted");
01737     }
01738 
01739   return (param->mode == M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER);
01740 }
01741 
01742 
01743 /* local space size will be a multiple of 16 so that the size won't
01744  * have to be changed in phase2.  Phase1 vararg needs to know the
01745  * exact size of the local variable space. */
01746 
01747 int
01748 M_tahoe_fnvar_to_lvar (_M_Type type, long int *offset,
01749                        char **base_macro, int local_space)
01750 {
01751   int current_offset, total_local_space;
01752   int size, align, mod;
01753 
01754   total_local_space = 0;
01755   current_offset = local_space;
01756 
01757   /* First local variable cannot have zero offset else
01758    * wouldn't be able to increase offset in Ltahoe-phase2 */
01759   if (current_offset == 0)
01760     {
01761       current_offset = type.align / 8;
01762       total_local_space += type.align / 8;
01763     }
01764 
01765   *base_macro = "$LV";
01766 
01767   switch (type.type)
01768     {
01769     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
01770     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
01771     case M_TYPE_INT:
01772     case M_TYPE_LONG:
01773     case M_TYPE_LLONG:
01774     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
01775     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
01776     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
01777       size = type.size / 8;
01778       align = type.align / 8;
01779       mod = current_offset % align;
01780       if (mod != 0)
01781         current_offset += (align - mod);
01782       *offset = current_offset;
01783       total_local_space = current_offset + size;
01784 
01785 #if 0
01786       fprintf (stderr,
01787                "MCM PARM (bytes): s %d, a %d, m %d, l %d, co %d, t %d\n",
01788                size, align, mod, local_space, *offset, total_local_space);
01789 #endif
01790 
01791       break;
01792 
01793     default:
01794       M_assert (0, "M_tahoe_fnvar_to_lvar: Unrecognized fnvar type");
01795     }
01796 
01797   return ADDR_ALIGN (total_local_space, 16);
01798 }
01799 
01800 
01801 /* local space size will be a multiple of 16 so that the size won't
01802  * have to be changed in phase2.  Phase1 vararg needs to know the
01803  * exact size of the local variable space. */
01804 
01805 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01806 int
01807 M_tahoe_lvar_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, long int *offset,
01808                      char **base_macro)
01809 {
01810   int i, off;
01811   int size, align, mod, tp;
01812 
01813   /*
01814    * the LOCAL section must be max. aligned initially
01815    */
01816 
01817   /* Note:  JEP 12/20/95
01818 
01819    * The first local variable cannot have a zero offset from the beginning
01820    * of the local variables.  This is because the true offset from sp is
01821    * adjusted in O_annotate of phase2 but the non-zero offset stack offset
01822    * address is converted to an add and zero offset in phase1.
01823    * Ex.  8($LV) -> add $r1 = 4,$LV, 0($r1) 
01824    * If the initial offset is 0, the add instruction is not created and a 
01825    * later offset adjustment cannot be made. */
01826 
01827   if (n > 0)
01828     off = type[0].align / 8;    /* first local can't have zero offset */
01829   else
01830     off = 0;
01831 
01832   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
01833     {
01834       tp = type[i].type;
01835       if (tp == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG ||
01836           tp == M_TYPE_BIT_INT ||
01837           tp == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
01838         M_assert (0, "M_lvar_layout: bit field not allowed");
01839 
01840       size = type[i].size / 8;
01841       align = type[i].align / 8;
01842 
01843 #if 1
01844       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_UNION || type[i].type == M_TYPE_STRUCT)
01845         {
01846           /* For struct parameter passing to work
01847              nicely, structs MUST be at least
01848              8 byte aligned. */
01849           if (align < 8)
01850             align = 8;
01851         }
01852 #endif
01853 
01854       mod = off % align;
01855       if (mod != 0)
01856         off += (align - mod);
01857       offset[i] = off;
01858       off += size;
01859       /*
01860          printf("size %d, align %d, offset %d, endoff %d\n",
01861          size, align, offset[i], off);
01862        */
01863     }
01864 
01865   /*
01866    * Local variables are relative to $LV
01867    */
01868   *base_macro = "$LV";
01869 
01870   return ADDR_ALIGN (off, 16);  /* the total size needed, mult. of 16 bytes */
01871 }
